meanings.definition: Firmly fixed or anchored to the land.
meanings.sent1: The ship was safe and landfast in the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The tree's roots were deep and landfast in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The landfast house refused to budge even in the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: Her beliefs were as landfast as the mountains, unwavering and strong.
meanings.sent5: The landfast foundation of the building ensured its stability during the storm.

meanings.definition: A strip of ice attached to the shore.
meanings.sent1: The explorers cautiously approached the landfast ice near the coast.
meanings.sent2: The seals rested lazily on the landfast ice, enjoying the sun.
meanings.sent3: The penguins waddled comically on the landfast ice, slipping and sliding.
meanings.sent4: The landfast ice acted as a barrier, preventing the ship from reaching the open sea.
meanings.sent5: The landfast ice glittered in the sunlight, a beautiful sight against the dark water.
